title:
Yielding in colloidal gels: from local structure to meso-scale strand
  breakage and macroscopic failure
authors:
Himangsu Bhaumik, Tanniemola B. Liverpool, C. Patrick Royall, Robert
  L. Jack
abstract:
We study creep flow and yielding of particulate depletion gels under constant
shear stress, combining data on different length and time scales. We
characterise the breakage of meso-scale strands in the gel. Breakage events are
distributed homogeneously in space, corresponding to macroscopically ductile
flow. At the microscale, a spatio-temporal analysis of structural and
mechanical metrics connects properties of strands before and after they fail,
indicating that strand breakage is statistically predictable. Using results
from different scales, we discuss the interplay between creeping and aging
dynamics, and we demonstrate a viscosity bifurcation.
